I completely agree with you! The art style and visuals of Elden Ring are truly breathtaking. The dark, gothic aesthetic and the sense of mystery and darkness that permeates the game's world are perfectly captured through the use of lighting, shadows, and color palette. The attention to detail in the environments, characters, and creature designs is astonishing, and the sense of scale and grandeur is palpable.

The blend of dark fantasy and medieval elements, with a hint of otherworldly mystery, is a perfect fit for the game's narrative and setting. It's clear that the developers have drawn inspiration from a wide range of sources, from Gothic architecture to medieval mythology, and have woven them together to create a unique and captivating visual identity for the game.

I'm also excited to see how the game's visuals will translate to gameplay. With the emphasis on exploration and discovery, I'm hoping that the game's world will be full of hidden secrets and surprises, and that the visuals will play a big role in guiding the player through the game's narrative. The use of subtle visual cues, such as faintly glowing paths or mysterious symbols, could add an extra layer of depth and immersion to the gameplay experience.

It's also worth noting that the game's visuals seem to be heavily influenced by the works of H.P. Lovecraft, which adds an extra layer of depth and complexity to the game's narrative and world-building. The use of cosmic horror elements, such as ancient, otherworldly beings and mysterious, eldritch powers, could add a sense of existential dread and uncertainty to the game's atmosphere, making the experience even more immersive and unsettling.

Overall, I think the art style and visuals of Elden Ring are a major selling point for the game, and I'm excited to see how they will be used to tell the game's story and guide the player through the game's world.

What do you think about the game's soundtrack and sound design? From what I've heard, the music and sound effects are going to be a major part of the game's atmosphere and immersion.
